Description: Pair of shovel stirrups (going with saddle Af.3891), damascened, made of iron, foil (white metal), string (cotton).
Curator's comments: The Christy registration Slip has "Egypt" deleted and "Span[ish] South America" added. However the stirrups are said to go with saddle Christy 3891 which is said to be from Egypt. Af.3890 to Af.3897 form a set of horse trappings. They were probably purchased by Henry Christy when he was in the Eastern Mediterranean in 1850.
